game

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    The Player class stores a player's name and score. To create a new Player, use the constructor
    Player(String name).
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    AlexKerzner
    See Also:
    Player(), Player(String), getName(), getScore(), getGamesPlayed(), addGame(boolean game_was_won), resetScore()

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player()
      Calls Player("Guest").
      Player(java.lang.String name)
      Creates the player with name name, and sets their score to 0.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int addGame(boolean game_was_won)
      Adds a game to the total games played.
      int getGamesPlayed()
      Returns the number of games played.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the player's name.
      int getScore()
      Returns the player's current score, as an integer.
      void resetScore()
      Resets the player's score and total number of games played to 0.
      java.lang.String toString() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • addGame

        public int addGame(boolean game_was_won)
        Adds a game to the total games played. If game_was_won is true, increments score by 1.
        Parameters:
        game_was_won - true, if the player won the game
        Returns:
        player's new score, as an integer
        See Also:
        Player

      • resetScore

        public void resetScore()
        Resets the player's score and total number of games played to 0.
        See Also:
        Player
